Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No Lane Markings and Worn Out Markings, 17th June
item.description:
This slip road and junction is very dangerous where it changes from 2 lanes to 3 lanes, as it also has multiple turns available before proceeding onto the A102 proper. There is no signage and no clear lane markings indicating which lanes are for ahead or for which turn--the first or the second. As there are multiple right turns consecutively, I have witnessed multiple near collisions as vehicles do not have clear guidance on what lane they should join when proceeding from the light, heading northward or which lane they should use for turning. Please address this as urgently as possible, as it is a safety issue. Thank you for your time.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woolwich Road, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rat activity, 17th June
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Morpeth Grove, Hackney, London

item.title: Between 116 to 124, 17th June
item.description:
Road surface has a pothole, filled poorly and uneven surface that causes traffic noise. In general this section of the road makes a lot of noise, possibly due to old tarmac not resurfaced and keeping up with the heavy, and often speeding traffic.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mansfield Road, Gospel Oak, London

item.title: Furniture dumped in bin, 17th June
item.description:
The lady in the picture dumped the items plus more in a communal bin. She doesn’t not live in this building, she approached me when I parked my van very aggressively. She told me the council would not take it so she’s dumping it here. The building is Lincoln house, the person lives at 10 Boyd way

item.title: Drug users & homeless campsite, 17th June
item.description:
This has been up for several days, there are local well know.n drug users and professional beggars from London Bridge in and out all day. Today around 8-10 of them were hanging around it. There are noises coming from it in the morning along with lots of waste and litter strewn around. This side of the park feels unsafe.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Hatchers Mews, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kensington Road, Knightsbridge, London
